title: Good deal: Standing desks we like from Fully are on sale ahead of Black Friday
content:
The Dealmaster has been rounding up the best early Black Friday deals we can find for the past few weeks, but today we wanted to highlight an especially notable sale on standing desks and related home office accessories from Fully, which we've previously recommended in our guide to gearing up your home office.

Up through November 30, the company is taking 15 percent off nearly all of the standing desks, desk frames, converters, chairs, monitor arms, shelving, and other home office accessories in its online store. Many of these discounts have also been duplicated on Fully's Amazon's storefront via on-page coupons, if you'd rather shop from there. For context, street prices on Fully desks (among others) have steadily risen over the past several pandemic-addled months, so the discounts here don't bring the lowest prices we've ever tracked. Still, for those wanting to adopt a standing desk today, the sale is a good opportunity to save on a few options we like.

Among the discounted items we've tested and recommended are Fully's Jarvis Standing Desk and the Cooper Standing Desk Converter. While the Jarvis isn't our top overall standing desk pick—Uplift's V2 desk offers a handful more customization options, though it isn't as accommodating to shorter frames—it's still an appealing choice from both an aesthetic and functional standpoint. The sustainably sourced bamboo top on our test model helps the desk fit in like semi-high-end furniture, classing up the room while making the office feel less office-y. You can also choose from desktops made of laminate, natural wood, and whiteboard materials. Each varies in price, with laminate costing the least, and sustainably sourced natural wood fetching a higher price. And yes, you can use dry-erase markers on the whiteboard top.
